subject: JUnit test suite hierarchy
msgSnippet: Hi, I was wondering why TestListener interface doesn t have a startSuite and an endSuite method? I was looking to create a data-driven test suite  but the Ant
messageBody:
Hi,

I was wondering why TestListener interface doesn't have a startSuite
and an endSuite method? I was looking to create a data-driven test
suite but the Ant reporting options aren't able to represent this
hierarchy.

So I looked at the Swing UI Test Runner source, which has it's own
implementation, as does the Eclipse version as well, which build their
own hierarchy. I had a look at the code in JUnit and it looked as
though adding appropriate methods to TestSuite, TestResult and
TestListener could easily create a way of representing hierarchies to
all listeners. Obviously, you may want to provide a a new
TestListener2 interface, or something to maintain binary
compatibility, but I was wondering it anyone else has ever hit this? I
could of course provide a patch and tests to interested parties.

Cheers,

James
